title: Publication
description: An basic entry for defining publications

sitePublicationId.description: The ID from the data provider that describes the publication at the data provider site. ie: the pub id from a MOD.  This is useful and required as many MODs have non-pubmed ids that are the reference for bulk-submission data, curator annotations, etc...

pubMedId.description: The id from pubmed when available.

summaryReference.description: A publication mini-reference for display. No constraints here yet - but examples the BGI group provide included title, authors, journal, volumne, pages ie: Aamar, E., and Dawid, I.B. (2008) Protocadherin-18a has a role in cell adhesion, behavior and migration in zebrafish development. Dev. Biol. 318(2):335-346
